org.rdkit.knime.util

Class DialogComponentEnumFilterPanel<T extends java.lang.Enum<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • DialogComponent
      • org.rdkit.knime.util.DialogComponentEnumFilterPanel<T>

  • public class DialogComponentEnumFilterPanel<T extends java.lang.Enum<T>>
extends DialogComponent
    This component has similar functionality as the column filter panel. The difference is that it takes enumeration items as the include/exclude elements rather than columns.
    Author:
    Dillip K Mohanty, Manuel Schwarze

    • Field Summary

      Creates a new enumeration filter panel with three components which are the include list, button panel to shift elements between the two lists, and the exclude list.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DialogComponentEnumFilterPanel

        public DialogComponentEnumFilterPanel(SettingsModelEnumerationArray<T> enumArrayModel,
                                      java.lang.String label,
                                      java.util.List<T> listItems,
                                      boolean bAllowEmptySelection)
        Creates a new enumeration filter panel with three components which are the include list, button panel to shift elements between the two lists, and the exclude list. The include list then will contain all values to filter.
        Parameters:
        enumArrayModel - The model that stores the values for this component. Must not be null.
        label - Label for dialog on to of the main component. Can be null.
        list - List of items for the combobox. If no list or an empty list is provided all possible values will be taken from the Enumeration used in the settings model.
        bAllowEmptySelection - Set to true to allow that the user selects nothing (include list is empty in that case).

      • hideItems

        @SafeVarargs
public final void hideItems(T... items)
        Removes the specified enumeration items from either include or exclude list and notifies all listeners. Does not throw an exception if the argument contains null elements or is not contained in any of the lists.
        Parameters:
        items - The items to be hidden.

      • resetHiding

        public final void resetHiding()
        Re-adds all hidden values back to the exclude list.

        Parameters:

        bVisible - True to show a button. False to hide it.
